==== Notes ====

===== wireless connection with WPA2 CCMP/AES, static IP =====
* install resolvconf
<pre>
sudo apt-get install resolvconf
</pre>

* transform your WPA key in hex
<pre>
wpa_passphrase 'your_ssid' 'your_WPA_key_in_ASC'
</pre>

* /etc/network/interfaces for a static IP (adapt it to your network config)
<pre>

auto lo
iface lo inet loopback

auto ath0
iface ath0 inet static
address 192.168.0.2
gateway 192.168.0.254
dns-nameservers 212.27.53.252 212.27.54.252
netmask 255.255.255.0
wpa-driver wext
wpa-ssid your_ssid
wpa-ap-scan 1
wpa-proto RSN
wpa-pairwise CCMP
wpa-group CCMP
wpa-key-mgmt WPA-PSK
wpa-psk your_WPA_key_in_hex
</pre>

===== activate the wireless led =====

See <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.20/+bug/64541|#64541]]</nowiki>.

* create /usr/local/bin/wifi-led
<pre>
sudo gedit /usr/local/bin/wifi-led
</pre>

* copy and paste, save and exit
<pre>
sysctl -w dev.wifi0.ledpin=1
sysctl -w dev.wifi0.softled=1
</pre>

* set it to executable
<pre>
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/wifi-led
</pre>

* create /etc/udev/rules.d/10-wifi-led.rules
<pre>
sudo gedit /etc/udev/rules.d/10-wifi-led.rules
</pre>

* copy and paste, save and exit
<pre>
KERNEL=="ath0", RUN+="/usr/local/bin/wifi-led"
</pre>

* activate it
<pre>
sudo udevcontrol reload_rules
</pre>

===== hardware wireless switch =====

It's not working, see <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/120856|#120856]]</nowiki>.
